newsitem.title: UK: Rutherford says Close takes majority stake.
newsitem.headline: Rutherford says Close takes majority stake.

text.p: UK investment manager Rutherford Asset Management said on Tuesday UK investment bank and fund group Close Brothers had taken a substantial majority shareholding in Rutherford.

A spokeswoman confirmed statements by Beacon Investment Trust Plc, of which Rutherford is the investment manager, and Granville Holdings Plc, which said it was acquiring the management contract for Eaglet Investment Trust Plc from Rutherford.

Close Investment Management managing director Jonathan Thornton told Reuters Close had taken a 92 percent stake in the business, with the balance held by Rutherford directors Andrew Buchanan and Stephen Hazell-Smith.
The stake had been bought from a variety of sources, including 54 percent shareholder Peter Michael and a 10 percent stake from Peter Webb.
Rutherford's only management contract is with 23 million stg trust Beacon, following the acquisition of the Eaglet contract by Granville and the loss of the Pilot Investment Trust contract recently.
Granville said Webb, manager of Eaglet, would join the group.
It said Webb would be responsible for setting up an institutional investment management arm specialising in growth companies.
Eaglet was set up in 1993 by Webb to invest specifically in UK smaller companies with a market capitalisation of less than 50 million stg.
